3.47 
Rights of the fair spouse 
1. The spouse who is honest and in need of maintenance has the right to claim maintenance from the spouse who is dishonest, for a maximum period of three years. 
2. The amount of maintenance shall be determined by the court, taking into account the financial situation of both spouses. Maintenance shall be ordered in the form of periodic monthly payments or a lump sum of a fixed amount. If there is a change in the financial situation of one of the spouses, the spouse concerned may apply to the court for the maintenance to be increased, reduced or terminated. 3. The payment of maintenance to a spouse in good faith shall automatically cease if he or she remarries or after the expiry of the three-year period during which the maintenance was payable.
